RB:¬†Everton's Harrison Armstrong has been earning rave reviews on loan at Preston North End and looks a superb all-round midfielder. It's only a matter of time before he gains David Moyes' trust and gets a regular run of Premier League experience.

PF: Ayden Heaven has impressed at United and could find himself in England contention by the end of 2026.

DK: Following an eye-catching start to his Chelsea career, Est√™v√£o looks set to have a breakout World Cup as a starter for Brazil, no less.

HP:¬†Ayyoub Bouaddi is already catching the eye for Lille in Ligue 1, so it's no surprise to see Europe's top clubs linked. A big move could propel him to the very top.

AT:¬†Yan Diomande at RB Leipzig (clubmate Antonio Nusa is also a shout, especially if he stars at the World Cup for Norway).

AW:¬†Lennart Karl has already looked the part at Bayern and hitting it big on the international stage is the next step for the talented teenager.

PW: He's already made a good impression and name for himself but Est√™v√£o at Chelsea looks like having all the tools to be a superstar.

RB:¬†A largely disruption-free World Cup.

PF: The good parts of the World Cup.

DK:¬†The World Cup coming to my home city for the first time.

HP: A dramatic end to what is shaping up to be one of the most thrilling Premier League campaigns at both ends of the table.

AT:¬†The World Cup not being the categorical nightmare it's currently shaping up to be.

AW: The expanded World Cup with so many newcomers.

PW: They only come around every four years so bring on the World Cup.

üì∏ MANDEL NGAN - Afp or licensors

title: Cowboys news: Brian Schottenheimer speaks on Trevon Diggs release
description: The latest news surrounding the Dallas Cowboys is here.
fullText:
This rocky situation finally came to an end.

FRISCO, Texas ‚Äì¬†As the new year comes around, the Cowboys will enter 2026 without Trevon Diggs on their roster after waiving the sixth-year CB on Tuesday.

In his weekly Wednesday press conference, head coach Brian Schottenheimer explained the team‚Äôs decision to move on from the former All-Pro.

‚ÄúIt was a culmination of multiple factors,‚Äù Schottenheimer said. ‚ÄúPerformance, other elements. He‚Äôs been an incredible player for this organization, and I really do, I truly do like Trevon a lot, I wish him nothing but the best and I‚Äôm excited to see where he lands and watch him continue his career.‚Äù

One of those factors came to light after Diggs was waived on Tuesday, as reports surfaced that Diggs did not take the team‚Äôs flight back to Dallas from Washington after the Cowboys‚Äô 30-23 win over the Commanders on Christmas, and instead elected to remain in Washington with his family.

‚ÄúIt was one of many factors, it was not the only factor,‚Äù Schottenheimer said. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not the Grinch that stole Christmas. I love Christmas, I love my family. But at the end of the day, we have a protocol that we go through and the process was not followed.‚Äù

Schottenheimer explained that his protocol is unless there is ‚Äúa family emergency or something specific,‚Äù the team travels together both to and from games. He added that Diggs did not tell him he would be staying behind until the team was in the locker room following the game.

‚ÄúFirst time I heard about it, Trevon grabbed me after the game,‚Äù Schottenheimer said. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm celebrating a big win, and I explained to him the protocol, which has always been the protocol, we go up as a team, we come back as a team. And he decided to make a decision. I‚Äôll say this: It was not the only reason that this decision was made.‚Äù

Not playing linebacker Logan Wilson in Week 17 could be the final nail for Matt Eberflus in Dallas.

It‚Äôs¬†extremely¬†difficult to lose a trade when all you give up to acquire a solid veteran linebacker is a seventh-round draft pick, but lo and behold, the Dallas Cowboys have managed to pull it off.

The linebacker in question, of course, is Logan Wilson, whom Dallas acquired from the Cincinnati Bengals just ahead of the trade deadline in early November. And here we are in late December, and the 29-year-old has already fallen out of favor with Dallas defensive coordinator Matt Eberflus, so much so that he took exactly zero snaps in the Cowboys‚Äô¬†Christmas Day victory¬†over the Washington Commanders.

Now, has Wilson made a huge impact since coming over from the Bengals. No, he hasn‚Äôt. But he also hasn‚Äôt been given much of an opportunity, as he‚Äôs only taken more than 30 snaps once while wearing a Cowboys uniform, and that was in his first game with the team in Week 11 against the Las Vegas Raiders.

Kenneth Murray Jr., meanwhile, whose 40.1 overall PFF grade ranks 82nd among 87 eligible linebackers, continues to get 40-plus snaps per game and literally took¬†every single¬†defensive snap against the Commanders.

Cowboys executive vice president and CEO Stephen Jones attempted to chalk Wilson‚Äôs lack of playing time up to ‚Äúconfusion,‚Äù but he clearly wasn‚Äôt thrilled with what transpired.

‚ÄúThat was unfortunate with Logan,‚Äù¬†Jones told¬†105.3 The Fan. ‚ÄúThey didn‚Äôt have many snaps throughout the game, much less obviously in the first half. I will say it was, I wouldn‚Äôt call it a mistake, but some confusion in terms of how that rotation was supposed to go with [LBs coach Dave] Borgonzi. It certainly wasn‚Äôt the intent for him not to play a snap, but sometimes the game with not many snaps on one particular side of the ball, things can not go according to plan. I‚Äôm sure Schotty will address that as well.‚Äù

The hope train for Brian Flores is in full force.

With¬†Dallas Cowboys¬†defensive coordinator¬†Matt Eberflus being on the hot seat,¬†a large portion of the fanbase has become obsessed with one man who could bring one of the most fun defensive schemes to town:¬†Minnesota Vikings¬†DC Brian Flores.

Flores‚Äîwho is on an expiring deal in Minnesota‚Äîis expected to be a hot asset this offseason¬†and¬†a head coaching candidate. And while a ‚Äúlateral‚Äù move from a coordinator position to another is uncommon, Flores inadvertently fueled Cowboys Nation‚Äôs hopes during a press conference on Monday.

Flores sounds very non-commital to the Vikings

Speaking to reporters on Tuesday, Flores addressed reports about his ‚Äútalks‚Äù with the Vikings before the imminent end of his deal. The Vikings DC was very non-committal about his future in Minnesota, while acknowledging there‚Äôs a business side to his situation.

‚ÄúI said this many times, I‚Äôve loved my time here in Minnesota,‚Äù Flores¬†said. ‚ÄúMy family loves it, the state of Minnesota has been tremendous to me, (HC Kevin O‚ÄôConnell) mentioned there‚Äôs been great dialogue, and there has. Now we‚Äôll just let the club and my representation handle the rest.‚Äù

Asked if he wanted to ‚Äúcome back‚Äù to Minnesota, Flores again said he loves Minnesota but noted things have to line up.

‚ÄúIf everything lines up and it fits‚Äîfrom a football standpoint, it fits,‚Äù Flores said. ‚ÄúI think there‚Äôs always a businness part of this. The football all lines up. We‚Äôll just see where it all goes.‚Äù

That doesn‚Äôt sound just like a coach who is only seeking a head coaching opportunity but rather a coach who is open to anything, even being a defensive coordinator elsewhere.

Changes certainly have to be made to fix a putrid Cowboys defense.

This season has seen the Dallas Cowboys field one of the worst defenses that they have ever had in franchise history. At some points they were able to stop the bleeding, but for the most part it has been an absolute disaster.

Defensive coordinator Matt Eberflus has been the target of many for criticism and blame, and it stands to reason that he will be held accountable by team leadership when it comes time to assess what happened.

Jerry Jones appeared on 105.3 The Fan on Tuesday morning and noted that Eberflus is certainly responsible, although not all on his own, and that changes are to be expected ‚Äúpronto‚Äù following the season‚Äôs end.

Jerry Jones makes it clear on @1053thefan that he views the defensive breakdown in 2025, ‚Äúhas been team wide.‚Äù Jones said, ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not all Eberflus at all.‚Äù He said decisions will be made, "pronto," when it comes to whatever changes will be made.

‚Äî Todd Archer (@toddarcher) December 30, 2025

title: Adam Bradford's College Football Playoff quarterfinals picks
description: Who does Trojans Wire's Adam Bradford have winning in the College Football Playoff quarterfinals?
fullText:
Earlier this month, I picked each first round game of the College Football Playoff. It did not go particularly well for me.

Can I do better in the quarterfinals? Here are my picks for the New Year's slate of playoff games:

Miami is having its best season in 23 years. But Ohio State is simply too good for the Hurricanes to overcome.

With Miami and Texas Tech both losing, we get a semifinals consisting solely of SEC and Big Ten teams‚Äîyet another sign that those two conferences are a clear tier above the rest.

Indiana beats Alabama in the Rose Bowl, and it isn't considered an upset. Imagine telling that to someone from pretty much any other year in college football history.

Ole Miss lost to Georgia earlier this season with Lane Kiffin. The Rebels suffer the same fate without him

Based on my above predictions, we would get the following matchups in the semifinals:

-Fiesta Bowl: (3) Georgia vs. (2) Ohio State

-Peach Bowl: (5) Oregon vs. (1) Indiana

This article originally appeared on Trojans Wire: Trojans Wire's Adam Bradford picks CFP quarterfinals

title: Maresca could leave Chelsea before Man City match
description: Chelsea boss Enzo Maresca could leave his post before Sunday's Premier League match against Manchester City.
fullText:
Chelsea manager Enzo Maresca could leave his post before Sunday's match against Manchester City, with relations between the Italian and the club's hierarchy having deteriorated.

The Blues have won just once in their past seven Premier League matches and sit fifth in the table - 15 points adrift of leaders Arsenal.

After their most recent game - a 2-2 draw with Bournemouth on 30 December - assistant manager Willy Caballero said Maresca felt too unwell to speak to the media, but it is understood his absence was more due to him considering his next steps.

There are reports of a board meeting on New Year's Day to address the situation.

Though they have fallen off the pace in the league, Chelsea have reached the Carabao Cup semi-finals, are preparing to restart their Champions League campaign and will face Charlton in the FA Cup third round.

At the end of November, Chelsea appeared in a harmonious place, with the team third in the Premier League and having recently dismantled Barcelona in the Champions League.

Just one league win followed in December but it is not just results that added to the focus on Maresca, with fissures emerging between the Italian and the club's hierarchy.

Maresca stunned key figures at the club - and even his own staff - when, after beating Everton 2-0 for Chelsea's solitary Premier League win in December, he said "many people" had made it his "worst 48 hours" since joining the club.

Those comments came from a position of strength after a good performance but were viewed dimly by the club hierarchy, at whom they appeared to be aimed.

Despite that, the plan remained to conduct an end-of-season review to decide whether to move forward with Maresca or part company.

Those with knowledge of Maresca's views, though, said he was capable of walking away having grown unhappy at a multitude of factors, including encouragement to pick certain players, and a lack of protection from the club about the quality of his work.

All of which has made for an unsettling situation, with Chelsea - whose players will return to work on Friday - closer in points to 15th place than third in the Premier League.

They next face Manchester City to start a difficult month that also includes games against Arsenal and Napoli.

And it is possible - before that potentially definining period - that Maresca will not be in charge.

Chelsea's primary goal this season is to qualify for the Champions League, which remains realistic, while also aiming for domestic cup runs.

Chelsea were satisfied with Maresca at the end of last season when he delivered Champions League qualification - regarded internally as his most important achievement - plus success in the Conference League and Club World Cup.

While victory in Europe's third-tier competition was broadly expected, beating Paris St-Germain to be crowned 'world champions' was a welcome surprise.

Maresca had delighted key figures at Stamford Bridge - including sporting directors Paul Winstanley and Lawrence Stewart, and influential co-owner Behdad Eghbali.

In line with the agreed strategy when the Italian moved from Leicester City in 2024 - for which the club paid ¬£10m - he focused on coaching the team while those above him oversaw much of the backroom staff, medical department and transfers.

Their transfer policy - signing the world's best young players from 'lesser' leagues to create the youngest team in the Premier League - remains in place.

Maresca knew what he was signing up for - and his issues are not about the quality of players or the strategy, but about the perception of his work with a young group.

The Italian is encouraged to rotate his squad, but often feels that when he does so in the Premier League, they drop points. He has also openly urged reporters to question the club's hierarchy.

Those familiar with his thinking say he has defended his work because he believes he is performing better than many have acknowledged, given the squad's age. He also feels the club should have offered him stronger protection from criticism.

Maresca also wanted to take on some external engagements following the club's recent successes. He had floated the idea of publishing a book but was blocked by the club, and spoke at Il Festival dello Sport - an event in Italy organised by La Gazzetta dello Sport newspaper - without their permission.

He also made public that he disagreed with the club not signing a central defender after Levi Colwill injured his anterior cruciate ligament in pre-season. The club's hierarchy explained that doing so could prompt academy prospect Josh Acheampong to request a transfer, which ultimately led Maresca to back down.

Those close to Maresca, who has switched agents from the Wasserman agency to Jorge Mendes, say he is weighing up his future. He has been mooted as a potential successor to Pep Guardiola at Manchester City, which Maresca described as "100% speculation".

In addition, he has increasingly avoided wearing club tracksuits, opting instead for his own clothing.

Chelsea face a packed January schedule across four competitions.

They begin with Sunday's Premier League trip to the Etihad, with a series of London derbies - home and away - against Fulham, Crystal Palace, Brentford, and West Ham before the end of the month.

In addition, they have an FA Cup third-round tie away to Charlton, a Carabao Cup semi-final first leg against Arsenal, and two Champions League fixtures - at home to Pafos and away to Napoli.

Chelsea realistically need to win both European games to avoid the play-off round and secure a top-eight finish in the league phase.

The fifth place they occupy in the Premier League may be enough to secure a return to the Champions League for the 2026-27 season.

Latest Chelsea news, analysis and fan views

Ask about Chelsea - what do you want to know?

title: NFL Week 18 picks: 49ers take NFC's No. 1 seed; Steelers win AFC North
description: Sam Farmer makes his picks and predictions for the final week of the NFL regular season, with the 49ers beat the Seahawks and the Steelers prevailing.
fullText:
Los Angeles Times NFL writer Sam Farmer examines the matchups and makes his predictions for Week 18 of the NFL season.

All lines and over/under numbers are according to FanDuel Sportsbook.

Last week, Farmer posted a 9-7 (.563) record. Through the first 17 weeks of the season, he is 164-92 (.641).

Using point spreads with the scores Farmer predicted, his record against the spread in Week 17 would have been 4-12 (.333). For the season, his record against the spread is 120-136 (.469).

All times are Pacific and TV reflects broadcasts in the Los Angeles area.

Saturday, 1:30 p.m. TV: ABC, ESPN.

Line: Buccaneers by 3. O/U: 44¬Ω.

This was a three-point win by the Panthers when these teams met two weeks ago and figures to be just about that close in the rematch. Hard to trust Tampa Bay, which has lost seven of its last eight games. This showdown comes down to the wire and Carolina wins with a field goal to clinch the NFC South title.

Pick: Panthers 24, Buccaneers 21

Saturday, 5 p.m. TV: ABC, ESPN.

Line: Seahawks by 1¬Ω. O/U: 49¬Ω.

As hot as Seattle is, San Francisco is surging and has the experience and home crowd at its back. It will be a really physical game and the winner claims the conference title. Seattle has lost seven of eight to the 49ers with the only win being last season and by three points.

Sunday, 10 a.m. TV: NFL Ticket.

The Packers are locked in as the No. 7 seed, and the Vikings are playing for pride. Have to believe with all the injuries his team has dealt with, Green Bay coach Matt LaFleur is going to make preserving health a priority. So no matter what happens at quarterback, I like the Vikings winning at home.

Sunday, 10 a.m. TV: NFL Ticket.

The Philip Rivers experiment was so much fun, but now it‚Äôs back to planning for the future with Riley Leonard. Division crown is a longshot for Texans, but they can still improve their seeding.

Sunday, 10 a.m. TV: NFL Ticket.

Line: Jaguars by 11¬Ω. O/U: 47¬Ω.

The Titans were on the wrong end of a laugher when these teams met at the end of last month. Now they‚Äôre playing for pride whereas the Jaguars have every incentive to keep their foot on the gas. The Jaguars have won seven in a row, averaging 30 points during that streak.

Sunday, 10 a.m. TV: NFL Ticket.

Here are a couple teams who are out of the playoff race but have assembled winning streaks. The Falcons handled the Saints pretty easily in New Orleans last month and should win a closer game at home.

Sunday, 10 a.m. TV: NFL Ticket.

It‚Äôs a small consolation but the Cowboys are determined to finish with a .500 record, so they‚Äôre incentivized. Pride and a pass rush will keep the three-win Giants in this one. Figures to be reasonably high-scoring, although that could be tempered by a bitter-cold breeze.

Sunday, 10 a.m. TV: NFL Ticket.

Bengals coach Zac Taylor says it‚Äôs ‚Äúan absolute nightmare‚Äù for his team to face Myles Garrett, and that might be so, but Cincinnati gets the edge in this one. Joe Burrow over Shedeur Sanders. The Bengals have six wins and the Browns have four. Do you still call that state bragging rights?

Certainly not a meaningless game for the Rams. They need to gather some momentum heading into the postseason, because at the moment they‚Äôre rolling backward. The Cardinals have surrendered an average of 37 points in the past four games (all losses). Rams roll, but what does it portend?

Line: Broncos by 11¬Ω. O/U: 36¬Ω.

The Chargers are resting Justin Herbert and other starters, so this is about getting out of Denver without injuries. Trey Lance has accounted for himself well in those rare chances he gets, but he‚Äôll be under heavy pressure from that Broncos pass rush. These teams keep it on the ground to make it a quick one.

Sunday, 1:25 p.m. TV: NFL Ticket.

The Bears need to recapture some of their swagger after losing at San Francisco, and the Lions are leaking confidence by the week. Six turnovers? Really? The Lions are going to play hard for Dan Campbell, but disdain for a division rival will only take them so far.

Sunday, 1:25 p.m. TV: NFL Ticket.

The Bills can improve their playoff seeding with a win, and the Jets have packed it in for the season. Buffalo needs to wash away the foul taste of that one-point loss to Philadelphia, plus the Bills want to turn off the lights at Highmark Stadium in style. Should be pretty lopsided.

Sunday, 1:25 p.m. TV: NFL Ticket.

Talk about coming full circle. This will feel like an exhibition game. Better buy a program so you can figure out who‚Äôs on the field. The Chiefs have a better roster, and they feed the ball at Travis Kelce early and often. Disappointing seasons for a pair of future Hall of Fame coaches.

Sunday, 1:25 p.m. TV: NFL Ticket.

Line: Patriots by 10¬Ω. O/U: 45¬Ω.

The No. 1 seed is within reach for the Patriots. The Dolphins are playing for pride and individual contract incentives. Barring a bizarre twist, this one is pretty straight-forward. Mike Vrabel has his New England players ready to enter the playoffs on a roll ‚Äî and in the frosty cold.

Sunday, 1:25 p.m. TV: NFL Ticket.

The Eagles and Bears kick off at the same time, so Philadelphia will have to play hard in case it can move up for that No. 2 seed. Washington put up something of a fight when these teams met two weeks ago. Philadelphia is prone to offensive lapses, though, so this might not be a blowout.

Sunday, 5:20 p.m. TV: NBC, Peacock.

It‚Äôs winner-take-all in the AFC North. Judging by their performances last week, the Ravens should win going away. But that‚Äôs not how this rivalry works. These games are almost always super close, and Pittsburgh rarely loses at home to Baltimore. Aaron Rodgers comes through.

Get the best, most interesting and strangest stories of the day from the L.A. sports scene and beyond from our newsletter The Sports Report.

This story originally appeared in Los Angeles Times.

title: Chicago Bears by the numbers: Breaking down their potential 1st-round playoff scenarios
description: Sunday‚Äôs 42-38 shootout loss to the San Francisco 49ers on Sunday marked the first time in 12 years that the Chicago Bears lost when scoring at least 38 points. The last such loss came in a 45-41 loss to Washington on Oct. 20, 2013. Before that it hadn‚Äôt happened since 1958, according to Stathead. Here are the other numbers, stats and figures that stood out this week for the Bears.
fullText:
Sunday‚Äôs 42-38 shootout loss to the San Francisco 49ers on Sunday marked the first time in 12 years that the Chicago Bears lost when scoring at least 38 points.

The last such loss came in a 45-41 loss to Washington on Oct. 20, 2013. Before that it hadn‚Äôt happened since 1958, according to Stathead.

Here are the other numbers, stats and figures that stood out this week for the Bears.

The simplest scenario for the Bears is to beat the Detroit Lions on Sunday and clinch the No. 2 seed in the NFC. Even if Philadelphia beats Washington, which would give the Bears and Eagles the same record, the Bears hold the head-to-head tiebreaker. That would mean a matchup with the Green Bay Packers, who are locked in as the No. 7 seed.

If the Lions beat the Bears and the Eagles beat the Commanders, the Bears would drop to the No. 3 seed and face either the 49ers or Los Angeles Rams as the No. 6 seed.

If the Seahawks beat the 49ers in Saturday night‚Äôs battle for the No. 1 seed, the 49ers will remain in a wild-card spot. If the Rams then beat the 3-13 Arizona Cardinals, the 49ers and Rams would have the same record and Los Angeles would win the tiebreaker and earn the No. 5 seed ‚Äî landing the Bears a rematch against the 49ers.

If the 49ers beat the Seahawks, San Francisco would earn the No. 1 seed and Seattle would fall to a wild-card spot. The Seahawks still would have a better record than the Rams no matter what the Rams do in Week 18, so Seattle would be the No. 5 seed and Los Angeles the No. 6.

The Rams also would be the No. 6 seed if they lose to the Cardinals, regardless of what happens between the Seahawks and 49ers.

Bears coach Ben Johnson already said his team is ‚Äúplaying to win‚Äù in Week 18.

The Bears no longer can earn the No. 1 seed and home-field advantage throughout the NFC playoffs. The No. 2 seed, however, would guarantee them a home game not only in the wild-card round, but also in the divisional round should they advance.

‚ÄúPlaying at Soldier Field is absolutely one of the things that we wanted to do in the playoffs,‚Äù linebacker T.J. Edwards said.

Since 1920, according to Stathead, the Bears are 12-9 in the postseason when playing at home.

On the road ‚Äî which they‚Äôve done only once since 1995 (2020 versus the New Orleans Saints) ‚Äî the Bears are 4-10 all time. They haven‚Äôt won a road playoff game since 1995 and haven‚Äôt won any playoff game since the 2010 season.

Williams has 3,730 passing yards through 16 games with 25 touchdown passes and six interceptions.

He‚Äôs 109 yards shy of breaking Erik Kramer‚Äôs franchise passing record of 3,838 yards in 1995. Williams‚Äô season low is 154 yards against the Eagles.

He‚Äôs also 270 yards shy of becoming the first Bears quarterback to throw for 4,000 yards in a season. The Bears are the only NFL franchise that never has had a 4,000-yard passer.

Williams has thrown for 270 yards or 

The Detroit defense is surrendering 218.1 passing yards per game (ranked 19th), and the Lions have dealt with some significant injuries on defense. Before Christmas Day, when former third-stringer Max Brosmer and the Minnesota Vikings totaled 3 net passing yards, the Lions had given up 313.2 per game over their previous five games.

It‚Äôs not out of the question that Williams could reach 4,000 yards, but it would take one of his biggest games of the season.

It‚Äôs worth noting that Kramer also holds the Bears single-season record with 29 touchdown passes in 1995. Williams needs four to tie it. His 25 TD passes currently ranks fifth in franchise history.

All of those passing yards have to go somewhere. After big games Sunday night, wide receiver Luther Burden III and tight end Colston Loveland both surpassed 600 receiving yards on the season.

The Bears now have four pass catchers with at least 600 yards: DJ Moore (671 yards), Rome Odunze (661), Loveland (622) and Burden (617). The rookies Burden and Loveland have come on strong late in the season. Odunze was leading the pack before a foot injury sidelined him the last four games.

This is the first time since 2014 that the Bears have had four players with 600 or more receiving yards in the same season. Alshon Jeffery (1,133), Martellus Bennett (916), Matt Forte (808) and Brandon Marshall (721) did it that season, when Jay Cutler threw for 3,812 yards, second in franchise history. The Bears finished 5-11 and fired coach Marc Trestman.

According to Stathead, the 2025 and 2014 seasons are the only instances in Bears history that four players totaled at least 600 receiving yards.

How the Bears would feed all of these playmakers was one of the stories of the summer. The answer, it seems, is that each has had his moment. The distribution has been remarkably even across the board.

Moore leads the Bears with 49 receptions. Odunze, who hasn‚Äôt played since Nov. 28 in Philadelphia, still leads the team with 90 targets.

The Bears have scored 30 points or 

With 54 rushing yards against San Francisco, D‚ÄôAndre Swift passed 1,000 yards for the second time in his career. At 1,047, he‚Äôs 2 yards shy of his career high.

The Bears lead the NFL with 32 takeaways. The Jacksonville Jaguars, with 30, are probably the only team that can catch them in Week 18. The Bears are also best in the NFL with only 10 turnovers. The Houston Texans are next-best with 12.

Per the Bears, left guard Joe Thuney tied an NFL record for most regular-season starts in his first 10 seasons with his 162nd last week. With a start in Week 18, Thuney would pass Atlanta Falcons tackle Jake Matthews, who also started 162 games in his first 10 years. Thuney has missed only two regular-season games in his career, both in 2022 with the Kansas City Chiefs. He already holds the record for combined regular-season and playoff starts over his first 10 years with 183.

title: Brentford vs. Tottenham Hotspur Premier League Preview
description: Apparently all it takes to win in the Premier League is playing away from home.
fullText:
Winning ugly is better than not winning at all, and apparently Tottenham Hotspur has found the right formula to squeak out three points. After the blip against Forest, Spurs got the needed result against Palace last weekend ‚Äî away from home, of course ‚Äî and can start off the new year right with a similar effort at Thomas Frank‚Äôs old stomping grounds. Despite plenty of struggles this fall, Tottenham entered this matchweek just four points off fifth.

One point above Frank‚Äôs new side is his previous squad. Since falling to Spurs in North London less than a month ago, Brentford has taken seven points in three matches and surged up the table. Some of this is due to quality of competition, but Tottenham is in no place to scoff at taking the ‚Äúeasy‚Äù points. This is going to be a true test on New Year‚Äôs but at least there is some reason to believe.

Date: Thursday, January 1
Time: 3:00 pm ET, 8:00 pm UK
Location: Gtech Community Stadium, Brentford
TV: NBCSN/Peacock (US), Sky Sports Premier League (UK)
Table: Brentford (t-9th, 26 pts), Spurs (t-13th, 25 pts)

Even with it happening at home, last month‚Äôs win over Brentford was Tottenham‚Äôs best league performance in a long time. The 2.2-0.2 xG line was certainly the most dominant this campaign, and those figures were completely justified given how the match played out. That win did make it four straight for Spurs in this fixture, regardless of which club Frank is leading.

No midweek matches the past two weeks gave Frank a chance to deploy all his resources, possibly revealing his preferred choices. Two players stand out as being on either side of the cusp right now. The first is Archie Gray, who has started seven of the last eight fixtures and nabbed his first career goal over the weekend.

Spurs could certainly use an upgrade in central midfield, but if the personnel remains the same, it sure looks like Gray has broken into the Rodrigo Bentancur-Joao Palhinha double pivot, and rightfully so. Gray played well against Brentford last time and would relish the chance to repeat that performance. Keith Andrews has dabbled with his formations since that meeting, but Gray is a strong choice against any midfield combination.

Up top, Richarlison has been the primary Tottenham striker all season, but more so out of necessity than performance. He does now lead the team in goals and could have had two more at Selhurst Park, but he has not exactly sealed up the job. Though a striker signing is unlikely in January, the impending return of Dominic Solanke could push him to the bench; the Brazilian‚Äôs chances to hang on to the starting spot are quickly dwindling.

That 2-0 win at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium was just about everything Frank could have asked for against his former club. Spurs were surprisingly direct, aided by a start from Xavi Simons and a quality outing from Mohammed Kudus, with both working well in front of Gray and Bentancur. Brentford had nearly equal possession of the ball but generated just one shot on target, rarely threatening the Tottenham defense.

Brentford will obviously look to adjust from this loss ‚Äî and has looked pretty good since then ‚Äî while Spurs will try to anticipate some of these changes. Frank should have the advantage, knowing his previous outfit well, though execution plays just as large of a role as tactics. Tottenham‚Äôs win over Palace was no masterclass, but the ability to grind out wins on the road should not be overlooked.

I would expect the Bees to really go for this one. With six goals scored and just one conceded the past two weeks, confidence is high in Brentford. Spurs will need to absorb some pressure while also making the most of their chances (especially the aforementioned Richarlison). This does not feel like another 1-0 contest, so maybe Tottenham can take advantage of the home side‚Äôs surge in form and ambition, carrying forward last month‚Äôs success.

title: New York Jets News: Brady Cook getting another chance to start in Jets‚Äô season finale
description: Your daily links to the New York Jets
fullText:
Good morning Gang Green Nation! On behalf of the entire GGN staff, Happy New Year! We hope 2026 brings each of you happiness and success in whatever circumstances you find yourselves in. As for the Jets, well, let‚Äôs just say we‚Äôre happy to be turning the page on a new year. I won‚Äôt say things can‚Äôt get any worse. This franchise has shown the emptiness of that slogan time after time. I‚Äôll just say with tons of draft capital and ample cap space, at least we have a shot at seeing an improved Jets team in 2026.

title: Iwan Morgan joins Shrewsbury Town on loan
description: Brentford B forward Iwan Morgan has completed a loan move to Sky Bet League Two side Shrewsbury Town until the end of the 2025/26 campaign, subject to EFL, FA and Premier League approval.After establi...
fullText:
In the 2024/25 season, Morgan scored 25 goals in all competitions and made 42 appearances.

So far in the 2025/26 season, Morgan has remained a reliable goalscorer, scoring in a 4-0 win against Queens Park Rangers at Gtech Community Stadium and helping the west Londoners to progress to the knockout stages of this year's PL Cup with an important brace against West Bromwich Albion.

Speaking about the loan move, Brentford B head coach Sam Saunders said: ‚ÄúIwan has been a fantastic player to coach and he has consistently shown his quality in front of goal as well as his all-round contribution to the team outside of just the goals.

‚ÄúThis loan represents a fantastic opportunity for Iwan to showcase what he is about. Your first loan can be testing at times, but we are confident in his mindset, professionalism and ability to handle any challenges that come his way. We wish Iwan the very best of luck for this next step in his development‚Äù

Morgan becomes the latest B-team player to go out on loan this season, following Ethan Brierley, Benjamin Fredrick, Tony Yogane and Ben Krauhaus.

title: Lincoln Riley vowed to fix the Trojans' defense, but it faltered again in Alamo Bowl
description: The coach said "we have the personnel" to be great, and reaching that level will fall on a new defensive coordinator, USC's third in five seasons.
fullText:
Two years ago, a day after he decided to fire Alex Grinch as USC's defensive coordinator, Lincoln Riley made a promise to those concerned about the future of the Trojans' defense.

‚ÄúI have complete belief, conviction. We will play great defense here,‚Äù the coach said in November 2023. ‚ÄúIt is going to happen. There's not a reason in the world why it can‚Äôt.‚Äù

Two years later, another defensive coordinator is out the door at USC. The day after Grinch‚Äôs replacement, D‚ÄôAnton Lynn, left to take the same job at Penn State, Riley stood in front of reporters, assuring everyone once again that soon enough, USC would be great on that side of the ball.

‚ÄúThe arrow,‚Äù he said Tuesday, ‚Äúis pointing straight up.‚Äù

‚ÄúThe opportunity for us to make a hire, to continue to make us better and to go from being a very good defense to being a great defense is the goal.‚Äù

Yet patience on that promise is wearing thin, especially given how the season had ended less than an hour before. USC blew a 10-point lead in the final five minutes against Texas Christian on Tuesday, a team playing without its star quarterback, before missing four tackles on a third-and-20 walk-off touchdown in overtime. The disastrous Alamo Bowl defeat would serve as an especially sobering reminder that while USC made progress under Lynn, it‚Äôs still a ways from heeding Riley‚Äôs guarantee.

And now, the defense will have to start again, with a new direction, a new scheme and a new coordinator, who will be Riley‚Äôs third hire in five seasons at USC.

In spite of all that, Riley was upbeat when asked about the unit‚Äôs future Tuesday night. He felt ‚Äúfantastic,‚Äù he said, about where USC‚Äôs defense was headed.

‚ÄúWe have the personnel,‚Äù Riley said of becoming a great defensive unit. ‚ÄúWe're on an upward trend. And, you know, there's going to be a lot of interest in this job. I mean, this will be an extremely, extremely coveted job, and I can already tell by the nature of what my phone's been like the last couple of days.‚Äù

Several potential candidates with deep experience, as well as close ties to USC athletics officials, are expected to be available.

Former Texas defensive coordinator Pete Kwiatkowski, who worked at Washington under current USC athletic director Jennifer Cohen, was let go by the Longhorns earlier this month. Cincinnati Bengals defensive coordinator Al Golden, meanwhile, worked closely with USC general manager Chad Bowden at Notre Dame and could be looking for a job as soon as next week.

Both coached college defenses that ranked in the top four in the nation in points allowed during the 2024 season.

USC appeared bound for a similar trajectory after Year 1 with Lynn. The Trojans allowed 10 fewer points per game, leaping from 121st in scoring defense under Grinch to 56th in his first season at USC. They got stingier on third down ‚Äî 106th nationally to 21st ‚Äî and in the red zone ‚Äî 119th to 69th. Lynn was even named candidate for the Broyles Award, given to the nation‚Äôs top assistant.

In some respects, USC‚Äôs defense continued to take steps forward in Year 2 under Lynn. It gave up fewer points and fewer yards per game. The pass rush improved, adding 10 sacks to its season total in 2025.

But the personnel on defense was less proven this season ‚Äî and more prone to mistakes. The secondary struggled through stretches. A thin group of linebackers was often overwhelmed. The defensive interior was manhandled for most of the season, and in each of their three regular-season losses, the Trojans were trampled on the ground.

Last month, when asked about the group‚Äôs inconsistency, Lynn said that USC‚Äôs youth forced him to ‚Äúscale back‚Äù significantly on defense. He actually wondered, in the wake of USC‚Äôs loss to Oregon, if he shouldn‚Äôt have scaled back the defense even more this season.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs different when you‚Äôre teaching an 18-year-old versus teaching a guy who has been at two to three schools who has already played a bunch of college ball,‚Äù Lynn said.

Lynn, nonetheless, leaves USC in a better place than when he arrived. The nation‚Äôs No. 1 recruiting class lands on campus next week, with plenty of highly ranked reinforcements on the way. Talented freshmen like defensive linemen Jahkeem Stewart and Floyd Boucard as well as defensive back Alex Graham are rising stars who should be ready to step into significant roles.

But USC will have to replace three starters in the secondary, including Kamari Ramsey, its best linebacker [Eric Gentry] and its top run stopper on the defensive line [Anthony Lucas]. Whomever takes over as coordinator will be expected to take a significant step forward immediately, up against one of the nation‚Äôs toughest schedules in what should be a decisive season for the program.

Then there‚Äôs the matter of Riley‚Äôs job security, which could make any available top coordinator queasy.

Yet as far as the coach is concerned, the path to finding a great coordinator and fielding a great defense isn‚Äôt that far off from what USC has now.

‚ÄúI definitely don't want to press reset,‚Äù Riley said. ‚ÄúI'm excited about the process, and I think it's going to make us better, I know it will. So, we'll wake up tomorrow morning and we'll get on it.‚Äù

 In your inbox every Monday morning.

This story originally appeared in Los Angeles Times.

title: 2025 NFL Week 18: Hart‚Äôs Picks
description: Mile High Report‚Äôs Christopher Hart gives his picks for Week 18 of the 2025 NFL regular season.
fullText:
Week 18 of the NFL regular season is finally here. I was 10-6 with my Week 17 picks. With just sixteen games left, I‚Äôm 170-86 on the season. That‚Äôs over 65-percent accuracy which is quite good, but far below my 70-percent average from last season. Let‚Äôs see how well I do for the final week of regular season games.

Saturday Football (Afternoon Game) ‚Äî Carolina Panthers at Tampa Bay Buccaneers

With the Atlanta Falcons upsetting the Los Angeles Rams on Monday Night Football, the Buccaneers‚Äô path to the postseason had a wrench thrown int. They must now win and have the New Orleans Saints defeat the Atlanta Falcons to secure the NFC South and earn a playoff berth. That‚Äôs unfortunate news for them. Can they finally end their four-game win streak and do their part to get to the postseason? I think so.

Saturday Football (Night Game) ‚Äî Seattle Seahawks at San Francisco 49ers

This NFC West heavyweight matchup is for the division title and the number one seed in the NFC. Both of these teams have defied the odds and impressed all season. This is going to be a must-watch game for all football fans. The 49ers inched out a close victory in their first matchup in Week 1. I expect this will be another close game. I‚Äôve got the 49ers finding a way to gut this key game out in front of a hometown crowd.

Sunday Football (Early Game) ‚Äî New Orleans Saints at Atlanta Falcons

Both the Saints and Falcons have reeled off multi-game winning streaks after starting off the season horribly. As mentioned above, Tampa Bay fans are desperately hoping the Saints finish the season off on a high note and earn their fifth-straight victory. And guess what? I‚Äôm predicting that to happen. Based on my picks, the Buccaneers are in the playoffs as the NFC South champions.

Sunday Football (Earl Game) ‚Äî Cleveland Browns at Cincinnati Bengals

The Browns were able to upset the Pittsburgh Steelers and play spoiler last weekend. I don‚Äôt expect them to have the same success against the Bengals, who have notched back-to-back wins with impressive offensive performances. I‚Äôve got Cincinnati at home in this one.

"That was sick."

Mic'd Up | @altafiber pic.twitter.com/L23CO3bMBo

‚Äî Cincinnati Bengals (@Bengals) December 31, 2025

Saturday Football (Evening Game) ‚Äî Green Bay Packers at Minnesota Vikings

The Packers have dropped three in a row. Luckily, they already punched their postseason ticket. Meanwhile, the Vikings are riding a four-game winning streak. I‚Äôm not sure if the Packers are expected to rest players or not. They are the seven seed in the NFC regardless of the outcome. My bet is that is the case. With that in mind, I‚Äôll take Minnesota at home.

Sunday Football (Early Game) ‚Äî Dallas Cowboys at New York Giants

Another game, another division rivalry matchup. With the Giants beating the Las Vegas Raiders last week, they find themselves on the outside looking in with respect to the #1 pick in the 2026 NFL Draft. The Cowboys? Out of the playoffs for the second season in a row. Even so, I‚Äôve still got Dallas winning this one.

Sunday Football (Early Game) ‚Äî Tennessee Titans at Jacksonville Jaguars

There are some ways the Jaguars can still be the #1 seed in the AFC. That seems improbable. With a win against the Titans, they will be the AFC South champions and get to host a playoff game. I feel confident that scenario will happen.

Sunday Football (Early Game) ‚Äî Indianapolis Colts at Houston Texans

After a rough start to the year, DeMeco Ryans and the Texans have really done well down the stretch. Their defense has been the strength of their team that has carried them all season long. I‚Äôm predicting a win at home, which will likely lock them in as the #5 seed in the AFC playoff race.

Safe to say we were all feeling the same way as Coach üòÖ

ü§ò | #SonyPartner pic.twitter.com/RV3lcloW0P

‚Äî Houston Texans (@HoustonTexans) December 31, 2025

Sunday Football (Afternoon Game) ‚Äî New York Jets at Buffalo Bills

A failed two-point conversion attempt at the end of last week‚Äôs game officially kicked the Bills out of contending for the AFC East title. That belongs to the New England Patriots. Regardless, I think they will find a way to beat the Jets who‚Äôve been awful the entire season. I‚Äôm taking Buffalo at home.

Sunday Football (Afternoon Game) ‚Äî Detroit Lions at Chicago Bears

With the Bears losing to the 49ers, they have no shot at the #1 seed in the NFC. They are assured the second or third seed no matter what happens in this game. Some thought Ben Johnson might rest his players, but he stated earlier in the week they are playing to win‚Äîindicating the starters will be a go for Sunday‚Äôs division rivalry game against the Lions. Division games are always tough, and the Lions are a gritty team, but I think the Bears find a way to end the season off with a big victory. I‚Äôm taking Chicago.

Sunday Football (Late Game) ‚Äî Kansas City Chiefs at Las Vegas Raiders

It makes my heart smile the Chiefs and Raiders have had down seasons. I don‚Äôt really care who wins this game. I‚Äôm taking Kansas City here which will officially gift the Raiders the #1 pick next April.

Sunday Football (Early Game) ‚Äî Los Angeles Chargers at Denver Broncos

The Chargers and Broncos are both in the playoffs. Los Angeles will be a wild card team, but the Broncos can earn the AFC‚Äôs top seed, first-round bye and homefield advantage by taking down their rivals in front of Broncos Country on Sunday. That‚Äôs a result I‚Äôm hoping for and believe will happen. Obviously, I‚Äôm taking Denver.

Throwing it üîô at @EmpowerField this Sunday üò§ pic.twitter.com/W6u2xonlyU

‚Äî Denver Broncos (@Broncos) December 30, 2025

Sunday Football (Afternoon Game) ‚Äî Miami Dolphins at New England Patriots

If the Patriots beat the Dolphins and the Broncos lose to the Chargers, New England will be the top seed in the AFC. With that at stake, they will certainly be playing their starters. I believe Drake Maye, who might even be the front runner for MVP honors, is going to have another huge game and deliver the Patriots their fourteen victory of the season.

Sunday Football (Afternoon Game) ‚Äî Arizona Cardinals at Los Angeles Rams

After their last second loss to the Falcons, the Rams are now relegated to being either the fifth or sixth seed in the NFC. Bummer for them. Whether they rest their starters or not, I think they defeat the Cardinals who have dropped eight games in a row. I‚Äôm picking Los Angeles.

Sunday Football (Afternoon Game) ‚Äî Washington Commanders at Philadelphia Eagles

The Eagles will be the second or third seed in the NFC no matter what happens here. They still have the perks of being the NFC East division winners and get to host a playoff game. The rumor is they may rest some starters. Even so, I think they beat Washington who‚Äôve looked terrible for the entire season.

Sunday Night Football ‚Äî Baltimore Ravens at Pittsburgh Steelers

The Steelers had a chance to make the playoffs and secure the AFC North division title had they beat the Browns last weekend. Unfortunately, they didn‚Äôt rise to the occasion and lost to the lowly Browns. That sets up a primetime matchup in Week 18 against the Baltimore Ravens. Baltimore was able to outduel the Green Bay Packers in Week 17. The Ravens are expected to have Lamar Jackson and a few players back for this game. It‚Äôll be a tough go of it on the road, but I think Baltimore is poised to come back and win the division. Pretty impressive given how bad they were earlier in the season.

title: Looking ahead to a hopefully much better 2026 for the Orioles
description: The year 2025 was trash. Let‚Äôs hope 2026 is better for the Orioles and the world.
fullText:
You‚Äôve made it! The cursed year 2025 is over and you have survived. 2026 will surely bring its own share of challenges but hopefully at least within the sphere of our favorite baseball team things will go better on the strength of internal and external improvements to the roster that are made this offseason.

There are now 84 days remaining until Orioles Opening Day. The start of spring training is much closer, as if you want to go by the pitchers/catchers report date for WBC participants, that‚Äôs just a month and eight days away from today. It will be here before you know it.

Is there another major Orioles move to be made between now and then? Today could turn out to be a day of big news regarding Japanese pitcher Tatsuya Imai‚Äôs signing with an MLB team. The deadline for him to sign is tomorrow and when you consider that there‚Äôs still going to be a physical involved, today might be the real day to lock down a framework of an agreement, and that will probably be reported if it happens rather than remain a secret until tomorrow.

I don‚Äôt know how much Mike Elias actually wants Imai or whether his want exceeds what other GMs will be willing to offer. I‚Äôm not expecting the Orioles to really be in on this, but who knows. It does still feel like there‚Äôs a need to be addressed at the top of the rotation, so if it‚Äôs not Imai, then pivoting to Ranger Su√°rez or Framber Valdez, whose markets will probably be impacted by where and for what price Imai signs, could still be in play.

Or maybe another trade? Who knows. With apologies for repeating myself, Elias has surprised me multiple times this offseason and he may yet surprise me again before it‚Äôs over. We are certainly living in a different world than we were with the Orioles last offseason.

Reddit AMA with beat writer Jake Rill (Reddit/Orioles)
This took place yesterday, so you‚Äôve missed the chance to ask a question. Most interesting for me was his assessment that the problem for the 2025 Orioles was 55% injuries, 40% underperformance by key players, 5% bad luck.

Ten New Year‚Äôs resolutions for the Orioles heading into 2026 (The Baltimore Sun)
It‚Äôs time to stop dwelling on how much last year sucked and instead think about the ways this year could be better.

Nothing of particular note has happened involving the Orioles on the first day of the year. Maybe that will change today! But probably not.

There are a few former Orioles who were born on this day. They are: 2012 outfielder Xavier Avery, 2006 infielder/outfielder Fernando Tatis, and 1958 infielder Foster Castleman.

Is today your birthday? Happy birthday to you! Your birthday buddies for today include: midnight rider Paul Revere (1735), early American flagmaker Betsy Ross (1752), author E. M. Forster (1879), longtime FBI director J. Edgar Hoover (1895), baseball Hall of Famer Hank Greenberg (1911), and DJ Grandmaster Flash (1958).

In 45 BC, January 1 marked the beginning of a new year for the first time in the Roman Republic as the Julian calendar, named after Julius Caesar, went into effect. The calendar remained in use in areas influenced by Rome for over 1,500 years before it started being replaced by the Gregorian calendar that remains in use today.

In 1808 AD, on the first day this was permitted by the Constitution, the United States banned the importation of enslaved people.

In 1818, Mary Wollstonecraft Shelley‚Äôs Frankenstein was first published. At the time of its publication, Shelley chose to remain anonymous.

In 1902, Michigan and Stanford played a college bowl game, which at the time billed itself as the Tournament East-West Football Game and today is known as the Rose Bowl. Michigan was a 49-0 winner in the game. This year‚Äôs edition of the Rose Bowl will be played today between Alabama and Indiana as part of the quarterfinal round of the college football playoff.

I received a book billing itself as The Big Book of Baltimore Orioles Trivia for Christmas. In it are 100 trivia questions. I‚Äôll include them in my Bird Droppings, skipping stupidly obvious questions like ‚ÄúWhat year did the Orioles begin play at Memorial Stadium?‚Äù and St. Louis Browns-related questions, until we‚Äôve exhausted the list. Here is question 1:

What was the Orioles record in 1970?

The book lists multiple choice answers, but I thought that would make it too easy for people on this site. If you are of an age that you remember the 1970 season, feel free to share a memory with us.

And that‚Äôs the way it is in Birdland on January 1. Have a safe new year.

title: Sidney Crosby‚Äôs stats in calendar year of 2025
description: A favorite new year tradition around here, let‚Äôs take a look at what Sidney Crosby did in the previous calendar year. It was another remarkable trip around the sun for Crosby on the hockey rink; what else is new, right? We can‚Äôt even be surprised at this point and yet it still ends up stunning [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
A favorite new year tradition around here, let‚Äôs take a look at what Sidney Crosby did in the previous calendar year. It was another remarkable trip around the sun for Crosby on the hockey rink; what else is new, right? We can‚Äôt even be surprised at this point and yet it still ends up stunning for how he keeps on chugging along and just where he has ended up until you step back, take a look and appreciate it. Crosby put up an amazing 2025, he only scored more goals in three other calendar years (2010, 2016 and 2022) than he was able to score this past year.

Crosby‚Äôs year also included winning the 4 Nations Face-off with Canada, headlined the NHL‚Äôs Quarter Century team, and oh yeah, passed Mario Lemieux for the most points in franchise history with the Penguins. Just another year for the goat.

Won Art Ross, Hart, Pearson trophies

Richard trophy winner, Olympic gold + golden goal

First team all NHL, Pearson winner

First team all NHL, Hart, Ross, Pearson winner, Olympic gold

Stanley Cup, Conn Smythe winner, First team all NHL

Stanley Cup, Conn Smythe winner, Richard trophy

Four Nations Face-off Winner, NHL Quarter Century team

As always, the consistency of Crosby is something to marvel at. He scored 1.14 points/game in 2025, virtually identical to the 1.15 that he produced in calendar 2024. That number is right in-line with the 1.16 points/game Crosby averaged from 2019-23. In short, that goes to confirm what you probably already knew: Crosby isn‚Äôt slowing down (well, I guess you can‚Äôt hold a .01 decrease against him) and was as productive this past year as he has been throughout the majority of his 30‚Äôs. In addition to that, Crosby was able to not just score at impressive rates, he also put in another strong year with availability. The Pens‚Äô captain appeared in 79 out of the 81 games the team played in the year of 2025, missing only two games in February with an arm injury.

Just how he got to his scoring levels in 2025 is perhaps more intriguing and notable: the assist numbers were down to the lowest levels since his injury years of 2011 and 2012 (not counting the 2020 COVID year), but he‚Äôs picked it right back up by scoring the goals himself. Crosby is no longer in firm control as the focal point on the power play and able to rack up a ton of assists like that, the special part has been his shift into scoring more goals himself. That would be remarkable at any age, when we‚Äôre talking a 37-38 year old that‚Äôs in his 21st season of NHL competition it becomes even more impressive and borderline unreal to consider that a player can keep chugging along at such a high level so very deep into his career. Then again, what else would you expect?

Crosby entered the calendar year of 2025 in 10th place on the NHL‚Äôs scoring list, as mentioned above he‚Äôs up to eighth now after passing Joe Sakic and Lemieux. There‚Äôs more on the horizon, Crosby has set himself up well within striking distance of current 5th place Ron Francis (71 points ahead at 1,798), with six and seventh spots of Marcel Dionne and Steve Yzerman becoming closer with just about every game played (Yzerman is currently 28 points ahead, Dionne 44).

It‚Äôll take beyond 2026 but looking at the big picture Crosby has moved within 200 points (194 to be exact) of matching second place Jaromir Jagr‚Äôs career point total. Should Sid decide to play even one more season beyond his current contract in 2027-28 and find a way to stay somewhat close to current scoring rates, Jagr and second place is looking very much within the realm of possibilities with another couple of 90ish point calendar years. That‚Äôs stunning yet still a realistic proposition given current outputs of the past few years.

Which means as time goes on it‚Äôs looking like a foregone conclusion for Crosby staking his claim to get on hockey‚Äôs Mount Rushmore with his relentless ascent in the point standings, as if it wasn‚Äôt already taking clear enough shape with his wide array of achievements.

Add in the Olympic opportunity coming up in Italy next month and 2026 could be yet another banner year in the unbelievably stout career of Crosby to continue to add more notches to his belt as he continues a historic journey.

title: Sean Payton reveals key area Broncos must improve in NFL playoffs
description: The Broncos rank 25th in the NFL with a -5 turnover differential. If they're going to make a deep playoff run, that number has to improve.
fullText:
Going into the final week of the regular season, the Denver Broncos (13-3) are tied with the best record in the NFL, and they currently hold the AFC's No. 1 playoff seed.

Overall, the Broncos are a well-balanced team with the NFL's fourth-best scoring defense and the AFC's seventh-best scoring offense. If there's one area where coach Sean Payton's squad is taking, it's takeaways.

Denver ranks 25th in the league with a -5 turnover differential. If the Broncos are going to make a deep run in the NFL playoffs, that number has to improve.

"The one area that has to improve is the turnover margin, and that can happen," Payton said. "We did a collective of the last 25 years of Super Bowl winners. It‚Äôs something like 114 in the plus. There‚Äôs been one Super Bowl winner in the last 25 years [in the negative] -- I‚Äôm just talking about when the playoffs begin, if that makes sense. When the playoffs begin, the Rams recently were the only minus-two turnover team. The rest added up to some crazy number, and so that‚Äôs something we have to improve on.‚Äù

Denver has 17 giveaways this season (11 interceptions and six lost fumbles), which ranks 13th-best. A more concerning total is just 12 takeaways (nine interceptions and three fumbles), which ranks fifth-worst in the NFL. In addition to protecting the football, the Broncos need to force more takeaways. If they don't, the odds will be against them as they seek a fourth Super Bowl title.

Social: Follow¬†Broncos Wire¬†on¬†Facebook¬†and¬†Twitter/X!¬†Did you know:¬†These 25 celebrities are Broncos fans.

This article originally appeared on Broncos Wire: NFL: Sean Payton reveals key area Broncos must improve in playoffs

title: How to watch Oregon vs. Texas Tech on Thursday: Time, TV channel
description: Find out the time, TV channel, streaming info and more ahead of Oregon's matchup with Texas Tech in the quarterfinals of the College Football Playoff.
fullText:
The Oregon Ducks have been waiting for this moment for exactly one year.

The last time the calendar switched over to a new year, the Ducks went to the Rose Bowl, where Ohio State swiftly bounced them out of the College Football Playoff. Although the opponent and site are different, Dan Lanning's crew is looking for some redemption.

This time, it will be Texas Tech in the Orange Bowl for Oregon in the quarterfinals of this postseason. Should they win, the Ducks will go on to the Peach Bowl in Atlanta to face either Alabama and their old nemesis Kalen DeBoer or Indiana, the team that handed Oregon its only loss this year.

The Red Raiders aren't a pushover, however, and the Ducks will have to play well in order to move on. Texas Tech is 12-1 and is the Big XII champion. They have a formidable offense and defense. All 12 of their victories have been over a 20-point margin. Playing in a close game or from behind isn't their forte. The Ducks are hoping to do just that and are counting on their past success in the Big Ten to carry them through on New Year's Day.

It's been almost two weeks since Oregon defeated James Madison 51-34 and are even more healthy going into this game with Texas Tech. But receiver Evan Stewart, who has been out all year and speculated to be available for this game, has been listed as out. Other than that, the Duck offense should be running on full cylinders against a very good Red Raider defense.

Oregon vs. Texas Tech will be broadcast nationally on ESPN in the Orange Bowl and the quarterfinals of the College Football Playoff, with the winner moving on to play either Alabama or Indiana in the Peach Bowl in Atlanta Jan. 9. The game will feature play-by-play announcer Joe Tessitore and analyst Jesse Palmer, along with sideline reporters Katie George and Stormy Buonantony. Fans can stream on ESPN+.

Location: Hard Rock Stadium, Miami Gardens, FL.

The Oregon Ducks vs. Texas Tech Red Raiders game starts at 9:00 a.m. PST on Jan. 1, 2026, in Miami Gardens, FL.

Odds courtesy of FanDuel Sportsbook as of Wednesday, Dec. 31

Moneyline: Oregon -134, Texas Tech +114

title: Wolves' 'still have a functioning heart'
description: From his earliest days as a young player at Aston Villa, Rob Edwards has always been good at finding the right tone in interviews.  It was indeed progress, a first tangible step towards whatever changed state Wolves are going to be in by next summer.  The two Christmas games at Anfield and Old Trafford have offered the first distinct signs of change under Rob Edwards, and not only in the use of different personnel, with more opportunities for Tolu Arokodare and Mateus Mane.
fullText:
From his earliest days as a young player at Aston Villa, Rob Edwards has always been good at finding the right tone in interviews.

He did so again at Old Trafford on Tuesday, looking slightly bashful when being congratulated for his team earning their first point since he took charge, even though they were entirely worthy of it.

"We've got to keep our feet on the ground," he said. "It feels nice that we've taken something from the game, but it is only a point. We've got to remember where we're at as well, so it's progress."

It was indeed progress, a first tangible step towards whatever changed state Wolves are going to be in by next summer.

It did also demonstrate again that a squad being ridiculed for its dismal points total still has a functioning heart. Away fans are rarely fooled, and their full-throated support all evening was a clear contrast to singing laments about old players a few weeks ago.

The two Christmas games at Anfield and Old Trafford have offered the first distinct signs of change under Rob Edwards, and not only in the use of different personnel, with more opportunities for Tolu Arokodare and Mateus Mane.

All over, Wolves were more physical and aggressive. This was most obvious in the performance of Jhon Arias, who appeared to relish filling in for the suspended Andre, crashing around midfield and earning himself room to play.

Edwards hopes his players now understand that they have set themselves a new standard: "I just said [to them] that's what it requires to get a point in the Premier League, not even three, that's the effort required."

This is all fine, and the faithful away support has seen efforts to be proud of, but the performances at home under Edwards so far have been of an entirely different character.

Even if salvation this season is beyond them, there is honour to win back in front of their home fans. On Saturday they face a deeply troubled West Ham at Molineux.

"We've seen four really good performances away from home, against four top teams - the challenge is we've got to perform like that at home," said Edwards. "There's more expectation, the atmosphere is difficult at times but we've got to blank that out and we've got to perform as we have away from home, at home. We've got to."

The home support has made it quite clear in recent weeks that it has heard enough excuses.

title: Sixers vs. Mavericks preview: How to watch, lineups, broadcast info
description: The Philadelphia 76ers will take on the Dallas Mavericks on Thursday to open the 2026 portion of the schedule.
fullText:
The Philadelphia 76ers will continue their 5-game road trip on New Year's Day on Thursday as they take on the Dallas Mavericks. The Sixers are 1-2 on this trip and will look to get back .500 on the trip with a win over the Mavs which would sweep the 2-game season series between the teams.

The Sixers are continuing to find ways to win games despite players being in and out of the lineup and their Big 3 only playing five games out of the first 31 on the season. Philadelphia is looking to keep things moving in the right direction against a Mavericks team that is also dealing with a ton of injuries and will be without sidelined guard Kyrie Irving among others. This is another big opportunity for the Sixers to keep growing as a team.

Here's when and where you should tune in to see the matchup:

Location: American Airlines Center Dallas, TX

Channel: NBA TV, NBC Sports Philadelphia

Sixers: OUT: Trendon Watford (left adductor strain), Kelly Oubre Jr. (left knee sprain)

Mavericks: OUT: Kyrie Irving (left knee surgery), Dante Exum (right knee surgery), Dereck Lively II (right foot surgery)

Sixers: Association Edition (White)

Mavericks: Statement Edition (Blue)

title: Jaxson Dart bullish on Giants' future, eager for full season with Malik Nabers
description: Specifically pointing to Malik Nabers' return in 2026, QB Jaxson Dart expressed optimism that the New York Giants are close to turning it around.
fullText:
New York Giants rookie quarterback Jaxson Dart closed out 2025 with unshakeable belief in a rapid turnaround, pointing to the team's talent and near-misses as proof that contention is close.

"No," Dart said when asked if the Giants are far from turning it around. "I mean, we've got the pieces. This is not an excuse, but obviously, we've had a tough schedule, and we've been in really tight games where this season could completely flip. So that's kind of just the league. It's those one-score games and who can capitalize on those moments.

"We've got a lot of talent. We have some good vets, and we have a ton of young guys who are going to continue to thrive. I‚Äôve said this a lot, we just have a ton of excitement for the future because we know what this thing can do and how we can flip this around."

Central to that vision is reuniting with star wide receiver Malik Nabers, sidelined for more than half the season with a torn ACL.

"We'll for sure continue to be together and light it up," Dart said. "I'm excited. Those are conversations that we have a lot, and we're two of some of the younger guys in the entire league at 22, so we've got a long future together, and there's going to be a lot of great moments. I know that he's been attacking this recovery process, and he's going to come back stronger and better, and he's going to be hungry for sure."

Dart admitted Nabers' absence stung deeply.

"He‚Äôs an incredible talent. He could beat anybody in the world. When you have a guy like that out there, he's a safety guy who's going to come down with the ball at all costs," Dart said.

With a young core headlined by the Dart-Nabers connection, the quarterback sees winning -- and plenty of it -- on the horizon.

This article originally appeared on Giants Wire: Jaxson Dart bullish on Giants' future, excited for Malik Nabers' return

title: Texas A&M is 'sitting at the top' of 2027 5-star Edge's list
description: Texas A&M is the current favorite to land 2027 5-star Edge Zyron Forstall, who is being compared to unanimous All-American Cashius Howell.
fullText:
Ahead of this Saturday's Under Armour All-American Game, which will feature more than half of the Aggies' 2027 recruiting class commits, the check-in portion, which took place on Tuesday afternoon, provided recruiting insiders plenty of insight regarding several elite recruits who have yet to commit to a program and are being connected to Texas A&M.

Prospects are taking notice after watching former Bowling Green edge Cashius Howell become an unanimous All-American during his final season with the Aggies, proving that head coach Mike Elko and his defensive staff, now including new co-defensive coordinator and defensive line coach Elijah Robinson, are on the right track.

For the No. 8-ranked prospect in the 2027 cycle, five-star edge Zyron Forstall, who will play in Saturday's game, revealed to Rivals insider Steve Wiltfong that the Aggies are "probably sitting at the top right now" of his recruitment list, which further proves that Robinson's hire, paired with Cashius Howell's acendance, has made the Aggies a top destination.

Forstall visited Texas A&M back on October 4. While the Aggies failed to take advantage of playing in Kyle Field during the first round of the College Football Playoff, falling 10-3 to Miami, Mike Elko's defense will continue to improve with better talent.

‚ÄúReally just the communication and how they showed interest and how consistent they‚Äôve been reaching out and trying to get me out as much as possible.‚Äù

‚ÄúReally I‚Äôd say going back to watching their defense play this year and them telling me a position I can play. They have a guy on the field showing this is what you‚Äôre going to do and we‚Äôre going to develop you.‚Äù

Elko and his staff reportedly see Forstall as a Cashius Howell clone, which is quite the compliment, and given his five-star status, Forstall is ahead of schedule.

According to Rivals, Forstall is currently positioned as the 9th-ranked prospect in the 2027 class, the No. 1-ranked Edge, and the 2nd-ranked prospect in Florida.

title: Aston Villa 'well positioned' again for Emery to 'take the club further forward'
description: Was Aston Villa's Premier League title run a three-week wonder, a fantasy bookended by two games against Arsenal?  It is too early to tell for sure - and let me nod to David Michael's complaint on this page on Wednesday, suggesting all talk of titles is too early at this stage anyway.  Unai Emery himself would no doubt also endorse that view.
fullText:
Is that it, then? Was Aston Villa's Premier League title run a three-week wonder, a fantasy bookended by two games against Arsenal?

Perhaps. But it doesn't matter. It is too early to tell for sure - and let me nod to David Michael's complaint on this page on Wednesday, suggesting all talk of titles is too early at this stage anyway. Unai Emery himself would no doubt also endorse that view.

So, let's qualify it a little and say Villa were being spoken of as contenders to Arsenal and Manchester City on account of having shown not only their ability to beat both those sides, but also to string together victories when playing well and when they weren't. Perhaps the title chatter is better viewed as a tacit acknowledgement that Villa may be ready to break out of the upper-middle group of Premier League clubs and bridge across to the top bracket.

The most significant factor holding them back may be squad depth, and there was evidence of this at Emirates Stadium.

For Arsenal, Gabriel scored on his first start for seven weeks and Gabriel Jesus built up his return from injury with his first goal in almost a year. In contrast, while Villa have handled injuries to Pau Torres and Tyrone Mings well enough, suspensions for Matty Cash and Boubacar Kamara pulled more players away from their ideal positions. Amadou Onana's tight hamstring at half-time stretched the elastic a little too far.

Even though the final result was conclusive, Villa had made Arsenal fret in the first 45 minutes. One sharper finish might have given Villa a half-time lead and changed the character of the match decisively.

But all is not lost. Far from it.

Saturday's game against Nottingham Forest will tell us more about whether Villa have been knocked far off balance by the second half at the Emirates. A confident showing in that game would confirm they are still capable of chasing the leaders hard in the second part of the season.

The longer-term view is more important, however. Villa start the new year third in the Premier League and well placed to reach the knockout stage of the Europa League. Their objectives for the campaign are clearly within range.

Villa have begun each previous new year under Emery well positioned to take the club further forward, and the same is true at the dawn of 2026.

title: Buffalo Bills slow starts raise playoff risk
description: Buffalo has been outscored in first halves, a dangerous trend to continue in the post-season.
fullText:
ORCHARD PARK ‚Äî One thing the Buffalo Bills have done rather effectively in 2025 is play from behind, though that‚Äôs not an attribute they want to continue to test once the postseason begins, especially since they‚Äôre probably going to be on the road for as long as they‚Äôre alive.

The Bills have not scored first in their past five games, yet they wound up winning the first four of those against the Steelers, Bengals, Patriots and Browns, and had Josh Allen not thrown a terrible pass at the worst possible moment on what would have been a game-winning two-point conversion last Sunday, they would have beaten the Eagles, too.

In the other games where they did not score first ‚Äî both Dolphins games, Falcons, the first Patriots game, and Buccaneers ‚Äî they rallied to win twice against Miami and Tampa Bay.

Add that up and the Bills are an admirable 6-4 when they don‚Äôt score first. Further, they have shown ability to rally late to win games, too, as they have won five games that they trailed in the fourth quarter.

‚ÄúI just don‚Äôt think there‚Äôs any quit on this team,‚Äù edge rusher Joey Bosa said. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve proved that a few games this year, that you just have to keep fighting. And when you have Josh back there with the ball in his hands, anything is possible.‚Äù

It began in Week 1 when they were 15 points behind Baltimore before pulling off an incredible comeback in the final four minutes to win 41-40. They entered the Week 3 Miami game trailing 21-14 going into the fourth quarter before winning 31-21.

In the 44-32 Week 11 shootout victory over Tampa Bay there were nine lead changes, the last coming when the Bills trailed 32-31 before going ahead for good with 9:06 left to play. They were down 28-18 in Week 14 to Cincinnati with 8:44 remaining before rallying to win 39-34. And at New England in Week 15 they were down 21-0 in the second quarter and 31-28 in the fourth before pulling out a 35-31 triumph.

The Bills have even had to dig themselves out of a hole in three of the six games where they scored first. They got up early against the Ravens, Jets, Saints, Panthers, Chiefs, and Texans, and the lone loss in that group was to Houston, but in only three of those wins ‚Äî Jets, Saints, Panthers ‚Äî did the Bills lead wire-to-wire.

That‚Äôs right, just three times all season, and none since Week 8 at Carolina, have the Bills not found themselves trailing at some point.

In its last eight games, Buffalo has managed just 23 first-quarter points, and across the first 16 games it has been outscored 82-78 in the first quarter. Extending through the first half, the Bills have been outscored 221-189.

A couple weeks ago, following Buffalo‚Äôs spectacular comeback in Foxborough, coach Sean McDermott was asked about his team‚Äôs penchant for falling behind and he said, ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs something we have to work on. Something we have to ‚Ä¶ get into a rhythm sooner. But there‚Äôs also an ability to adjust during a game. Anybody can come up with a game plan, but it‚Äôs also what happens when they take certain things away. Are you able to pivot and adjust? I think that‚Äôs the sign of a great staff.‚Äù

What‚Äôs concerning about the slow starts is that the Bills‚Äô passing game simply isn‚Äôt built to play from behind. Sure, they‚Äôve gotten by for most of the season, but looking at the five other teams who are already in the AFC playoff bracket who could, at some point, become an opponent, the Texans rank fourth in the league in pass defense in terms of yards allowed per game, the Chargers are sixth, the Broncos are eighth and the Patriots are 10th. Only the Jaguars lag behind at 22nd.

Among those teams, the Texans are the best overall defense in the league, and clearly proved that in their victory over Buffalo, while the Broncos rank third, the Chargers are fourth, the Patriots are sixth and the Jaguars are 12th. Of the other two teams still contention, the Ravens‚Äô defense ranks 25th and the Steelers are 27th.

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs not our mindset, I certainly understand why you‚Äôd ask that question because of the last few games in particular, but that‚Äôs not our mindset,‚Äù McDermott said of relying on rallies to win games. ‚ÄúOur mindset is to play a 60-minute game whatever it takes.‚Äù

Bottom line is this: There are some strong defenses in the AFC, and if the Bills get behind, it‚Äôs going to be tough to rally, especially if Allen has to repeatedly drop back and throw. They have to find a way to play with a lead once the postseason begins, or it could be a very short January, and Allen knows it.

‚ÄúObviously, we want to start faster in these games,‚Äù Allen said. ‚ÄúBut it‚Äôs being able to dig ourselves out and be battle-tested coming down the stretch here.‚Äù

‚Äî Sal Maiorana has covered the Buffalo Bills for more than four decades including 36 years as the full-time beat writer/columnist for the D&C. He has written numerous books about the history of the team, and he is also co-host of the BLEAV in Bills podcast/YouTube show. He can be reached at maiorana@gannett.com, and you can follow him on X @salmaiorana and on Bluesky @salmaiorana.bsky.social.

This article originally appeared on Rochester Democrat and Chronicle: Buffalo Bills need early leads for road playoffs

title: Auburn among top programs showing interest in 4-star QB Andre Adams
description: Andre Adams has built a strong relationship with Auburn head coach Alex Golesh, which is the driving force in the mutual interest.
fullText:
For the second straight season, Auburn football will fully rebuild its quarterback room ahead of the next season. However, their efforts are going beyond 2026.

In a recent interview with Marcus Benjamin of Rivals, 2027 four-star quarterback Andre Adams listed the programs at the forefront of his recruitment, including Auburn. Adams cites the relationship he built with the new head coach, Alex Golesh, as well as the offensive coaching staff, during their time at USF, as the driving force behind his heavy interest.

‚ÄúI got a great relationship with Auburn," Adams said. "The coaches from USF, Coach Golesh, and the staff he brought with him. I had a great relationship with them when they were at USF. Since they switched over, it‚Äôs still the same thing.‚Äù

Outside of Auburn, Adams is receiving interest from Mississippi State, Cincinnati, and Virginia Tech. He tells Benjamin that he plans to take an official visit to each school, with his visit to Auburn possibly taking place during the spring.

Adams is a four-star quarterback from the 2027 recruiting class. He ranks No. 16 among 2027 quarterbacks, and the Antioch High School product is the No. 8 recruit from the state of Tennessee.
